title.rendered: Acclime puts Philippines, India and Japan on M&A radar

content.rendered:
Martin Crawford, founder and CEO of Acclime, gave a further interview to Market Merger in which he outlines Acclime’s targets for ‘bolt-on’ acquisitions, and reports on progress made. Market Merger published the article on June 1st, 2021, and the copyright owners, Acuris, have given us permission to share the PDF with you.

In the article, Martin Crawford explains how Acclime has already gained a foothold in the Philippines with branding to follow, and confirms that Acclime is having ongoing discussions with partners in India and Japan. The article also describes how Acclime made eight M&A deals across Southeast Asia, Hong Kong and mainland China in 2020 despite the slow down in travel. The latest of these is CoSec Corporate Services in Australia, which was rebranded on June 1st, 2021 (Press release).

The article details how Acclime is still at the build-up phase to achieve a pan-Asia geographical coverage, especially in emerging markets. It also describes how Acclime is working on integration across its territories and continues to develop a state-of-the-art technology stack. This will provide secure document management and client access to take corporate services in accounting, tax and HR to the next level. Download the PDF to read more.
